examples: Reckless youth makes rueful age.
He often takes reckless risks, and one day he will come a cropper.
He acts wild and woolly, constantly engaging in reckless behavior without regard for rules or consequences.
John was a reckless driver when he was young, and now he has a criminal record and a hard time getting insurance.
He took a deep breath and reminded himself to stay calm and avoid any reckless maneuvers.
words.defineEn: not caring about the possible results of one's actions that could be dangerous
words.defineVi: không quan tâm đến kết quả có thể có của hành động của một người có thể gây nguy hiểm

words.defineEn: someone who writes plays for the TV, radio, or theater
words.defineVi: một người viết vở kịch cho TV, đài phát thanh, hoặc nhà hát

examples: Dramatizing their attractions, their products, their history, and their progress.
I saw that you could dramatize the image of the economic and other relationships which enslavers were creating in some ways as the parts of that metaphorical body.
Here dramatized by delightful activated models, is the story of how the automobile industry spreads employment.
So after a period of peace following Pocahontas' marriage to John Rolfe in 1614, dramatized here, things finally came to a head in 1622, when Chief Opechancanough led a rebellion against the English.
words.defineEn: represent something in a dramatic manner
words.defineVi: đại diện cho một cái gì đó một cách ấn tượng

examples: Some in Gaza launched incendiary balloons that sparked fires in Southern Israel.
For Donald Trump, this incendiary media environment is a weapon, and he wields it every day.
No, it had nothing to do with incendiary content at all.
Do you not think that in any way that’s incendiary?
And he got people to pay attention to him because he was saying really incendiary things.
words.defineEn: capable of catching fire spontaneously or causing fires or burning readily
words.defineVi: có khả năng tự bắt lửa hoặc gây cháy hoặc dễ cháy

examples: Imagine an incense stick.
He was incensed.
Workers here can produce around 400 incense sticks every hour.
Normally, incense sticks are made from charcoal.
And in the Sahih al-Bukhari Hadith, the description of Paradise by Allah's messenger includes the burning of agarwood as incense.
Susan saw how people could be persuaded to betray their values and principles for the right incentive, demonstrating that everyone has their price.
Innovation follows incentives.
Free products and payment are increasingly common incentives.
And cashless registers present no incentive for theft or robbery.
They had the very large incentives.
words.defineEn: something that is used as an encouraging and motivating factor
words.defineVi: một cái gì đó được sử dụng như một yếu tố khuyến khích và thúc đẩy

examples: Kids don't just absorb language verbatim from the older people around them, the way you might download the full text of a dictionary onto your phone.
They copied several passages verbatim from the War Department memo, including some about how disorders could be reactions to social factors or the environment.
That’s almost verbatim what I predicted would happen if he didn’t hire the right people.
That’s almost verbatim what I predicted would happen if he didn’t hire the right people.
They’re also going to launch Verbatim, a NEW linguistics show, very soon!
words.defineVi: sử dụng chính xác cùng một từ

words.defineEn: using or having an excessive number of words
words.defineVi: sử dụng hoặc có quá nhiều từ

words.defineEn: an expressive style that uses excessive or empty words
words.defineVi: một phong cách diễn đạt sử dụng các từ quá mức hoặc trống rỗng

words.defineEn: the superior of a group of nuns
words.defineVi: bề trên của một nhóm nữ tu

examples: This shift extended to architecture with the construction of the Abbey of Saint Denis in France in 1137.
This religious community does live a mostly cloistered life behind these abbey walls.
words.defineEn: a church with buildings connected to it in which a group of monks or nuns live or used to live
words.defineVi: một nhà thờ với các tòa nhà kết nối với nó, trong đó một nhóm tăng ni sinh sống hoặc từng sống

words.defineEn: the superior of an abbey of monks
words.defineVi: bề trên của một tu viện của các nhà sư

examples: It’s that palpable?
Because it's so palpable.
Is there a palpable difference?
Our anxiety is so palpable that we can't even see out of it to even work on anything.
Feeling the joy, maybe it's palpable there.
words.defineEn: capable of being perceived; especially capable of being handled or touched or felt
words.defineVi: có khả năng nhận thức được; đặc biệt có khả năng được xử lý hoặc chạm hoặc cảm thấy

examples: The author has a son with cerebral palsy.
Although research is ongoing, early evidence has shown that equine therapy seems to help with everything from cerebral palsy to autism.
Romy has cerebral palsy.
He actually does have cerebral palsy.
Meanwhile, equine therapy for cerebral palsy looks a bit different.
words.defineEn: a condition marked by uncontrollable tremor
words.defineVi: một tình trạng được đánh dấu bằng sự run rẩy không kiểm soát được

examples: But- People remember the cadence.
They remember the cadence, exactly.
Narrator: Conducted at a cadence.
I just usually try to find the best cadence.
It’s something that has a cadence that’s ongoing.
words.defineEn: the close of a musical section
words.defineVi: kết thúc một phần âm nhạc

words.defineEn: a brilliant solo passage occurring near the end of a piece of music
words.defineVi: một đoạn độc tấu xuất sắc xảy ra gần cuối một bản nhạc
tước đi lòng tự trọng của một người
